title: Cycle Of Seasons Hub
content:
=====
[[include component:preview
text= The Fae Courts once governed reality. As wrongs are righted they set out to take on their task once more.
]]
=====

[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

[[div style="text-align: right; margin-right: 2em; margin-top: -20px;"]]
by [[[Ethagon's Author Page| Ethagon]]]

[[/div]]


[[=]]
//A quiet harsh wind blows since aeons past
It flattens every stone and every tree with the thousand cuts of time
Only at rest when all is dead, the air too still to carry sound
From barren ground a sprout emerges stretching against the sky
As clouds part and a ray of light whispers your name//

[[/=]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
+ The Cycle of Seasons
++ Stories from the Fae Courts
[[/=]]

[[=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/cycle-of-seasons-hub/Cycles-of-Seasons-SunnyClockwork-HQ.jpg style="width: 50%"]]

[[=]]


+++ Introductory Seasons

@@ @@
**23^^th^^ September 1980**
**[[[SCP-6401|SCP-6401 — Court of the Feallen]]]**
by Ethagon
//Upon arrival in SCP-6401, Foundation Witnesses are guided by denizens towards wooden houses in various states of disrepair for the duration of their stay.//

@@ @@
**21^^th^^ December 1911**
**[[[They Had Names ]]]**
by AnActualCrow
//The uninvited can only enter the Court of Oblivion if they belong there, only if they're fit to witness the ghosts of fallen castles and phantasmal fog superimposed on the world of the living.//

@@ @@
**20^^th^^ March 2004**
**[[[NT-4041-Nimuedianetic-Karhu|NT-4041-Nimuedianetic-Karhu "]]]//[[span style="font-family: 'palitoonregular'"]][[[NT-4041-Nimuedianetic-Karhu| Her Lady's Thorn]]][[/span]]//[[[NT-4041-Nimuedianetic-Karhu|"]]]**
by Ethagon
//As of this point, the ruling position of [[span style="font-family: 'palitoonregular'"]]Her Lady's Thorn[[/span]] remains vacant, but several parties have made their claim to the crown and are currently in conflict over deciding the new ruler.//

@@ @@
**21^^th^^ June 2004**
**[[[SCP-6471 |SCP-6471 — A Midsummer Night's Game Online]]]**
by Ethagon
//You are in contact with the Supreme Summer Court of Esterberg. All statements made by you, related parties, and the Court as part of this conversation are objectively true.//

@@ @@
+++ Escalating Seasons

@@ @@
**22^^th^^ September 2004**
**[[[Secure Facility Dossier Site-118 |Secure Facility Dossier: Site-118 ]]]**
by Ethagon
//The nomenclative makeup of Site-118 has been severely disrupted by multiple anomalies. To counteract this a --bi--weekly day where communication using words is disallowed was introduced to the Site.//

@@ @@

**21^^th^^ December 2004**
**[[[Will Winter|Will Winter?]]]**
by Ethagon
//My apologies. As always this is no official court sitting for the Winter Court and there never will be. I just wanted to catch up with some old friends.//

@@ @@

**20^^th^^ March 2005**
**[[[SC-05/321-05/335| SC-05/321-05/335: Usurpation ]]]**
by Ethagon
//We've been at this farce for over a year now. The race for the Spring Throne should not have taken so long.//

@@ @@

**21^^th^^ June 2005**
**[[[truth-glamour| Truth Glamour: The Wanderer's Greatest Tool For Veracity ]]]**
by Ethagon
//Our greatest hope remains to find the Summer Court.//

@@ @@
+++ Inevitable Seasons

@@ @@
**22^^th^^ September 2021**
**[[[fall-witness-part-1|Fall Witness]]]**
**[[[fall-witness-part-1|Part 1 ]]] | [[[fall-witness-part-2|Part 2]]]**
by Ethagon
//The Autumn Court handles things that decline. Few things fit as well into their portfolio as SCP-6500.//

@@ @@

**21^^th^^ December 2021**
**[[[brings-the-hunt|Brings The Hunt ]]]**
by Ethagon
//No groups survive in the Court of Winter but the Wild Hunt. Had any of the creatures of winter the drive to be more, they would have left the Court. For all remaining, there is only the fog.//

@@ @@

**20^^th^^ March 2022**
**[[[spring-again|Spring Again (Webversion) ]]]**
by Ethagon
//All four of these stories first appeared in some form on the spring equinox, announcing the new era of the most recent iteration of the Spring Court.//

@@ @@

**21^^th^^ June 2022**
**[[[scp-8471|VNP-8471 — Return of the Summer Court]]]**
by Ethagon
//Daytime was just a few minutes longer, the summer in the southern hemisphere was the most evenly warm one in centuries and the sun shone brighter all year round.//

@@ @@
[[/=]]



----

+++ Context and Inspirations
* [[[SCP-4000|SCP-4000 — Taboo]]] by [[*user PeppersGhost]]
* [[[SCP-5925|SCP-5925 — The Holly King]]] by [[*user TheSlothSavant]]
* [[[SCP-5159|SCP-5159 — In The Name Of The King]]] by [[*user Tanhony]]
* [[[SCP-5213|SCP-5213 — The Oracle of the Fae]]] by [[*user Cyvstvi]]
* [[[SCP-6500|SCP-6500 — Inevitable]]] by [[*user Aethris]], [[*user DarkStuff]], [[*user Grigori Karpin]], [[*user HarryBlank]], Ihp, [[*user Placeholder McD]], and [[*user S D Locke]]
* [[[The Lands Nobody Returns From]]] by [[*user Ralliston]] and [[*user Uncle Nicolini]]
* [[[goc-tale-sequence-assessment|]]] by [[*user DrClef]]
* [[[Ralliston's Proposal]]] by [[*user Ralliston]]
* [[[esterberg-city-wikipedia|]]] by [[*user MontagueETC]], [[*user Jasiu06]], [[*user Jerden]], [[*user Ralliston]], and [[*user Zygard]]

+++ Recurring Characters
[!--
[[collapsible show="Contains Minor Spoilers"]]
--]
* **The Fool** — An archetype used in old Fae tales to explore the mythic remnants of the Fae Empire. It is unknown if this archetype corresponds to or describes a real person.
* **[[[SCP-5925|The Father of Winter]]]** — A former leader.
* **//[[span style="font-family: 'palitoonregular'"]]Her Lady[[/span]]//** — A former servant.
* **The Nameless** — Most lost their name in the Great Factory Purge. Some did before. Most are desperate to gain their own name, or any name, back.
* **Queen Mab** — A tormentor.
* **SCP-6401-A** — A Fae born of Autumn. As desperate for a real name as for power.
* **Edrisglair** — A tired judge.
* **Erlking** — An outsider. Peering in solely to return his daughter.
* **Dr. Randall Owings** — Faced with fight-or-flight the Site Director of Site-118 will choose fight every time.



[!--
[[/collapsible]]
--]

@@ @@

[[collapsible show="What is this?" hide="A Tale Series"]]

This is a series about the broken Cycle of Seasons, a legal system consisting of 4 Fae Courts each residing over a different aspect of reality (being, ceasing, not being, and becoming). While there are threats running throughout the story, the individual articles are for the most part stand-alone pieces, showing different aspects of the Courts and how they develop in the world of [[[from-120-s-archives-hub|From 120's Archives]]].

The main series is as of Summer 2024 concluded, but the Cycle of Seasons doesn't have to be the only Cycle of Fae Courts. If you want to make an article about another Cycle or write something involving the Seasonal Courts let me know and I'll add it to the hub.

[[/collapsible]]
